title: 115_hr2185
content: The "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" may be cited as the short title. It involves determining if foreign financial institutions have facilitated transactions for covered persons. The "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" requires the President to determine if foreign financial institutions have knowingly facilitated significant transactions for certain individuals and report to congressional committees every 180 days. The "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" mandates the submission of unclassified certifications for significant transactions or financial services, with the possibility of a classified annex. Transactions and financial services are deemed significant as per section 561.404 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. SEC. 3. Determination and certification of whether certain foreign persons have supported covered persons. The President must determine if foreign persons listed in specific attachments have supported certain individuals and report to congressional committees every 180 days. The determination must be in unclassified form but may include a classified annex. SEC. 4. COVERED PERSONS. A covered person includes an organization designated as a foreign terrorist organization by the Secretary of State or a foreign person whose property is blocked under specific Executive Orders related to terrorism and weapons of mass destruction proliferation. The curr_chunk lists various Executive Orders related to the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction and blocking property of certain persons in connection with Syria. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders related to blocking property and prohibiting transactions with Syria, including orders targeting human rights abuses and senior officials of the Syrian government. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders targeting transactions with Syria, Iran, and human rights abuses, including blocking property and suspending entry into the United States. The curr_chunk discusses the blocking of property and interests in property of Iranian persons under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, including Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps and its affiliates. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, definitions for "appropriate congressional committees," "foreign financial institution," and "foreign person" are provided. The curr_chunk defines terms such as "foreign terrorist organization" and "Iranian financial institution" in relation to the actions of foreign governments. The curr_chunk defines the "Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action" as the agreement reached in Vienna on July 14, 2015, by Iran and several other countries, along with all related implementing materials and agreements. The curr_chunk explains the definitions of "person" and "United States person" in relation to the Iran Nuclear Agreement Review Act of 2015.
